sn6.10:1.2: Then the bhikkhu Kokālika approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said:
sn6.10:1.3: “Venerable sir, Sāriputta and Moggallāna have evil wishes; they have come under the control of evil wishes. ”
sn6.10:1.4: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bhikkhu Kokālika:
sn6.10:1.5: “Do not speak thus, Kokālika! Do not speak thus, Kokālika!
sn6.10:1.6: Place confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna , Kokālika. Sāriputta and Moggallāna are well behaved. ”
sn6.10:1.7: A second time the bhikkhu Kokālika said to the Blessed One:
sn6.10:1.8: A second time the bhikkhu Kokalika said to the Blessed One:  “Venerable sir, although the Blessed One has my faith and trust, all the same I say that Sāriputta and Moggallāna have evil wishes; they have come under the control of evil wishes. ”
sn6.10:1.9: And a second time the Blessed One said to the bhikkhu Kokālika:
sn6.10:1.10: “Do not speak thus, Kokālika!… Sāriputta and Moggallāna are well behaved. ”
sn6.10:1.12: A third time the bhikkhu Kokālika said to the Blessed One:
sn6.10:1.13: “Venerable sir, although the Blessed One has my faith and trust, all the same I say that Sāriputta and Moggallāna have evil wishes; they have come under the control of evil wishes. ”
sn6.10:1.14: And a third time the Blessed One said to the bhikkhu Kokālika:
sn6.10:1.15: “Do not speak thus, Kokālika!… Sāriputta and Moggallāna are well behaved. ”
sn6.10:2.1: Then the bhikkhu Kokālika rose from his seat, paid homage to the Blessed One, and departed, keeping him on his right.
sn6.10:2.2: Not long after the bhikkhu Kokālika had left, his entire body became covered with boils the size of mustard seeds.
sn6.10:2.3: These then grew to the size of mung beans; then to the size of chickpeas; then to the size of jujube stones; then to the size of jujube fruits; then to the size of myrobalans; then to the size of unripe beluva fruits; then to the size of ripe beluva fruits.
sn6.10:2.4: When they had grown to the size of ripe beluva fruits, they burst open, exuding pus and blood. Then, on account of that illness,  the bhikkhu Kokālika died,
sn6.10:2.5: and because he had harboured animosity towards Sāriputta and Moggallāna, after his death he was reborn in the Paduma hell.
sn6.10:3.1: Then, when the night had advanced, Brahmā Sahampati, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, stood to one side, and said to him:
sn6.10:3.2: “Venerable sir,  the bhikkhu Kokālika has died,
sn6.10:3.3: and because he harboured animosity towards Sāriputta and Moggallāna, after his death he has been reborn in the Paduma hell. ”
sn6.10:3.4: This is what Brahmā Sahampati said.
sn6.10:3.5: Having said this, he paid homage to the Blessed One and, keeping him on his right, he disappeared right there.
sn6.10:4.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:
sn6.10:4.2: “Bhikkhus, last night, when the night had advanced, Brahmā Sahampati approached me and said to me: … (as above) … Having said this, he paid homage to me and, keeping me on his right, he disappeared right there. ”
sn6.10:5.1: When this was said, a certain bhikkhu said to the Blessed One:
sn6.10:5.2: “Venerable sir, how long is the life span in the Paduma hell?”
sn6.10:5.3: “The life span in the Paduma hell is long, bhikkhu.
sn6.10:5.4: It is not easy to count it and say
sn6.10:5.5: it is so many years, or so many hundreds of years, or so many thousands of years, or so many hundreds of thousands of years. ”
sn6.10:5.6: “Then is it possible to give a simile, venerable sir?”
sn6.10:6.1: Suppose, bhikkhu, there was a Kosalan cartload of twenty measures of sesamum seed. At the end of every hundred years a man would remove one seed from there.
sn6.10:6.2: That Kosalan cartload of twenty measures of sesamum seed might by this effort be depleted and eliminated more quickly than a single Abbuda hell would go by.
sn6.10:6.3: Twenty Abbuda hells are the equivalent of one Nirabbuda hell;
sn6.10:6.4: twenty Nirabbuda hells are the equivalent of one Ababa hell;
sn6.10:6.5: twenty Ababa hells are the equivalent of one Aṭaṭa hell;
sn6.10:6.6: twenty Aṭaṭa hells are the equivalent of one Ahaha hell;
sn6.10:6.7: twenty Ahaha hells are the equivalent of one Kumuda hell;
sn6.10:6.8: twenty Kumuda hells are the equivalent of one Sogandhika hell;
sn6.10:6.9: twenty Sogandhika hells are the equivalent of one Uppala hell;
sn6.10:6.10: twenty Uppala hells are the equivalent of one Puṇḍarīka hell;
sn6.10:6.11: and twenty Puṇḍarīka hells are the equivalent of one Paduma hell.
sn6.10:6.12: Now, bhikkhu, the bhikkhu Kokālika has been reborn in the Paduma hell because he harboured animosity towards Sāriputta and Moggallāna. ”
sn6.10:6.13: This is what the Blessed One said.
sn6.10:6.14: Having said this, the Fortunate One, the Teacher, further said this:
sn6.10:10.4: Having set evil speech and mind against them. ”
